name: ChunkHelper
description: The `ChunkHelper` class provides access to Minecraft chunk data and functionality within JsMacros scripts. This class allows you to interact with 16×16 world chunks, including reading block information, accessing entities, and querying various chunk properties.
overview:
A chunk in Minecraft is a 16×16×384 section of the world that contains blocks, entities, and various metadata. The `ChunkHelper` class provides methods to:

- Get chunk coordinates and dimensions
- Access blocks and their properties within the chunk
- Query heightmaps and biome information
- Find entities and tile entities in the chunk
- Search for specific block types
- Iterate through all blocks in the chunk

methods.name: getChunkX
methods.description: Returns the X coordinate of the chunk (not the world coordinate). This is the chunk coordinate, ranging from negative to positive values depending on world location.
examples:
let chunkX = chunk.getChunkX();
Chat.log("Chunk X coordinate: " + chunkX);

methods.name: getChunkZ
methods.description: Returns the Z coordinate of the chunk (not the world coordinate). This is the chunk coordinate, ranging from negative to positive values depending on world location.
examples:
let chunkZ = chunk.getChunkZ();
Chat.log("Chunk Z coordinate: " + chunkZ);

methods.name: getStartingBlock
methods.description: Returns the starting block position of this chunk (coordinate 0, 0, 0 relative to the chunk, which corresponds to world coordinates chunkX×16, chunkBottomY, chunkZ×16).
examples:
let startingBlock = chunk.getStartingBlock();
Chat.log("Chunk starts at: " + startingBlock.toString());

methods.name: getOffsetBlock
methods.description: Returns a block position relative to the starting block of this chunk by the specified offsets.

parameters.name: xOffset
parameters.description: The X offset within the chunk (0-15)

parameters.name: zOffset
parameters.description: The Z offset within the chunk (0-15)

examples:
let block = chunk.getOffsetBlock(8, 64, 8); // Center of chunk at Y=64
Chat.log("Block at chunk center: " + block.toString());

methods.name: getMaxBuildHeight
methods.description: Returns the maximum build height of this chunk (typically 320 in Minecraft 1.17+).
examples:
let maxHeight = chunk.getMaxBuildHeight();
Chat.log("Maximum build height: " + maxHeight);

methods.name: getMinBuildHeight
methods.description: Returns the minimum build height of this chunk (typically -64 in Minecraft 1.17+).
examples:
let minHeight = chunk.getMinBuildHeight();
Chat.log("Minimum build height: " + minHeight);

methods.name: getHeight
methods.description: Returns the total height of this chunk (max height - min height).
examples:
let height = chunk.getHeight();
Chat.log("Chunk height: " + height);

methods.name: getBiome
methods.description: Returns the biome identifier at the given position within the chunk.

parameters.name: xOffset
parameters.description: The X offset within the chunk (0-15)

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The Y coordinate in world space

parameters.name: zOffset
parameters.description: The Z offset within the chunk (0-15)

methods.name: getEntities
methods.description: Returns a list of all entities currently inside this chunk.

methods.name: getTileEntities
methods.description: Returns a list of all tile entity (block entity) positions inside this chunk. Tile entities include chests, furnaces, signs, etc.

methods.name: getInhabitedTime
methods.description: Returns the cumulative time (in ticks) that players have spent inside this chunk. This value affects local difficulty - the higher the inhabited time, the more difficult the chunk becomes, resulting in stronger mob spawns.
examples:
let inhabitedTime = chunk.getInhabitedTime();
Chat.log("Inhabited time: " + inhabitedTime + " ticks");

methods.name: getTopYAt
methods.description: Returns the maximum Y position of all blocks at the specified position according to the given heightmap.

parameters.name: xOffset
parameters.description: The X offset within the chunk (0-15)

parameters.name: zOffset
parameters.description: The Z offset within the chunk (0-15)

methods.name: getHeightmaps
methods.description: Returns a collection of all raw heightmap data for this chunk.

methods.name: getSurfaceHeightmap
methods.description: Returns the raw world surface heightmap for this chunk.

methods.name: getOceanFloorHeightmap
methods.description: Returns the raw ocean floor heightmap for this chunk.

methods.name: getMotionBlockingHeightmap
methods.description: Returns the raw motion blocking heightmap for this chunk (blocks that prevent movement).

methods.name: getMotionBlockingNoLeavesHeightmap
methods.description: Returns the raw motion blocking heightmap for this chunk, excluding leaves.

methods.name: forEach
methods.description: Iterates through all blocks in the chunk and calls the callback function for each block (optionally excluding air blocks).

parameters.name: includeAir
parameters.description: Whether to include air blocks in the iteration

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Function to call for each block

methods.name: toString
methods.description: Returns a string representation of the chunk containing its coordinates.
